courses.subject: ECON
courses.title: Research Development Project
courses.description: This is a special research course that allows students to develop research skills and advanced knowledge on a topic of choice of the students. Students may enroll in this course with the permission of the instructor, who will supervise the students from the choice of topics to the carrying out of analytical work and finally the writing up of a report. The student must submit a final report at the end of the course.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Economics
courses.learning_outcomes: To gain experience in conducting individual research under faculty guidance, culminating in a report that embodies an insightful survey of relevant literature, original thinking, and competent analyses of theoretical models or datasets.
courses.course_syllabus: The course syllabus will be provided by the project supervisor.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Course and Teaching Evaluation Survey conducted by the Department, informal feedback from students via diverse communication channels. Student consultation during the annual departmental retreat.
courses.required_readings: To be determined by the project supervisor.
courses.recommended_readings: To be determined by the project supervisor.

courses.subject: ECON
courses.title: Internship Experience in Economics
courses.description:
Students are encouraged to explore opportunities for internships to fit their own specific learning and career needs. However, all self-selected internships must comply with course requirements in terms of the duration of the internships, nature and level of work to be carried out, suitability with regard to the content of the MSc programme, and expected value-added to the students’ academic achievement and work-place experience. The internship arrangement will be subject to the approval of the MSc. Programme Office.
Students are required to complete a report related to the work carried out during the internship. The essay is to be submitted after completion of the internship and be assessed by the course instructor.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Economics
courses.learning_outcomes: Students will be able to integrate theoretical knowledge and problem-solving skills in a real-world environment.
courses.course_syllabus:
Students are encouraged to explore opportunities of internships to fit their own specific learning needs. However, all self-selected internships must comply with the course requirements, and be subject to the approval of the director of the MSc. Programme Office.

Students will be assessed by the course instructor afterward.
courses.feedback_evaluation: The course will NOT employ the University’s Courses and Teaching Evaluation (CTE), as the evaluation tool and reflection collected from the individual student will be collated instead to see the effectiveness of the course in the delivery of learning outcomes.
courses.required_readings: To be determined by the course instructor.
courses.recommended_readings: To be determined by the course instructor.

courses.subject: ECON
courses.title: Seminar in Economic Theory
courses.description: This course is designed to cover selected topics in economic theory. Such topics may include but are not limited to general equilibrium with time and uncertainty, analyses of markets with asymmetric information, contract theory, mechanism design, and social choice theory. We will encourage and guide the students to explore and discuss research topics in these areas.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MPhil-PhD Economics or MSc in Economics
courses.course_syllabus: To be determined by the instructor.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Course and Teaching Evaluation Survey conducted by Department, Informal feedback from students via diverse communication channels, Student consultation during annual departmental retreat.
courses.required_readings: Readings for the course are drawn from various textbooks and academic journals.

courses.subject: ECON
courses.title: Special Topics in Economics I
courses.description: This is a course on special topics in Economics. The topic may change from one year to another. Some recent topics are international trade, and monetary and financial economics.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in PhD Economics, MPhil Economics, MSc Economics or MSc Applied Economics
courses.learning_outcomes: Learning outcomes depend on the course topic and will be specified by the course instructor every year.
courses.course_syllabus: Course syllabus will be provided by the course instructor every year.

courses.required_readings: Required readings will be determined by the course instructor every year.
courses.recommended_readings: Recommended readings will be determined by the course instructor every year.
